stimulusHtml: Why do single-member district (SMD) electoral systems tend to promote two-party systems?
choicesHtml: Parties in a SMD electoral system have to build coalitions after elections to form a government, and these coalitions often develop into larger parties.
SMD electoral systems always require runoff elections, which discriminate against minor parties.
Only one candidate can win in a SMD electoral system, so minor parties are less likely to win.
A representative in a SMD electoral system is more accountable to voters, so representatives need larger parties to support their constituency service efforts.
